instructions:
CUSTOMER SERVICE INTERACTION TEST

You are about to start the "Customer Service Interaction" test. For this test, you will need to listen to information that is provided to you through the computer. We recommend using a headset or a set of quality speakers.

During this test you will play the role of a customer service agent who is responding to telephone calls for service. To do this you must first answer the call and enter the caller’s name and telephone number. When the "Incoming Call" button begins flashing and you hear the telephone ringing, click on the button to answer the call. After the customer provides you with their name and telephone number and you have entered that information in the appropriate fields, click the "Run Search" button.

Once you have brought up the customer information and at various points throughout the test, you will be presented with three different ways you, as the customer service agent, might respond to the caller. At those times, you will be asked to select the "Most effective" and "Least effective" response of the three choices. Each choice will be presented in a written format and will also have an audio version for you to listen to. You can listen to the response by clicking on the "Play Audio" button next to each response.

The "Most effective" response is the one which, in general, is most likely to create a good impression of the customer service agent to the caller in terms of communication, politeness, interpersonal interaction, demonstrating sound judgment, and effectively addressing the caller’s issues.

The "Least effective" response one which, in general, is most likely to create a poor impression of the customer service agent to the caller.

If there appears to be more than one most effective or least effective response, then please do your best to choose between them to indicate the very most effective or very least effective response.

Please choose one "Most effective" response and one "Least effective" response by clicking on the appropriate radio buttons.

Finally, at any time during this test you may click on the "Repeat caller’s last statement" button if you wish to hear the caller’s last comment again.

Good luck!

questions.notes:
Name: Johnston, Jackie
Prefix: Ms.
Address: 1746 Thompson Avenue
Telephone: 416-492-7698
History: Purchased Gold Service
Payment History: Credit card billed 1st of month
Credit card expiration date: 5/2009

responces.responceText: I apologize if you've had to wait in the past, but our computer system has been running slowly lately. Bear with me for a moment, please, and I'll pull up your account information as soon as I can... Now that I have it, how may I help you?
Sorry; the computer has been really slow lately. You know how that goes. Hang on one moment please... okay, now how can I help you?
We've really been having a lot of computer problems lately. I don't know how long this might take...okay, now that I have your information in front of me, how can I help you?
I'm sorry to hear you'd like to cancel. Would you mind telling me why?
What seems to be the trouble?
What's your problem?
Ms. Johnston, I understand that you're upset, but billing problems can happen to anyone.
Ms. Johnston, tell me specifically what the billing problems are so I can begin to resolve them for you.
Ms. Johnston, you've got two choices: either calm down or I'll end the call.
Yes, you were rude, but I understand your frustration.
It's okay. I understand that you were just frustrated with the situation.
I understand, but please don't take it out on me.
I see that on the 1st of the month, we mailed the bill that is due on the 30th. What I can do for you is send you a duplicate bill.
I'm showing that we sent you the bill. I don't know why you don't have it, but it's the same amount as last month. Why don't you just pay that amount?
Your bill must have gotten lost in the mail because I'm showing we sent it out to you. Why don't you check with the postal service?
Perhaps we'd better verify to see if we have the correct address in our database. Would you mind telling me your current address?
Let's start by double-checking on your address in our database. Where exactly do you live?
There is nothing we can do about you getting your bill late. What is your current address?
There must a problem with your telephone. Can you repeat what you just said?
I'm sorry ma'am. Would you mind repeating what you said?
I can't seem to understand a word you are saying.
That's 4261 Millford Avenue... It seems our records could be wrong. Can you confirm an address change?
Looks like we have a different address on file. Did you change addresses recently?
Did you move or something?
That's all right Ms. Johnson. Anything else on your mind today?
You should have told me that earlier. Ms. Johnson. Have you got any other concerns I can help you with today?
That's all right, Ms. Johnston. We have your correct address now. Anything else I can help you with?
Okay, I'm going to go.
Okay, thanks, you should be all set. Have a good day. Bye-bye now.
I'm glad I could help you today. If you have more questions, please feel free to call back. Have a good day.

questions.notes:
Name: Wilson, Wendy
Prefix: Mrs.
Address: 8627 Woodside Drive
Telephone: 419-462-8397
History: Purchased Model X8
Payment History: Paid by check
Check number: 7436

responces.responceText: Thank you, Mrs. Wilson; how may I assist you?
How may I assist you?
Thank you; what's your problem today?
Sometimes those things happen.
I doubt the post office would break your item.
Sounds like it could have happened that way.
There's no need to be rude; I didn't break your part. I'll send you another part.
We will ship you out a replacement part this afternoon.
I guess we can send you a new part later today.
You will get the part when it is finally delivered.
You should be receiving the part in three to five business days.
Ma'am, you should be getting it soon.
You're welcome; is there anything else I can assist you with?
It was nothing...was that all you needed help with today?
You're welcome; so that's it, right? Nothing else?
